title: Drawing, "Majolica pitcher", 18th century
medium: Black chalk, pen and black-brown ink, brush and sepia, blue wash on paper
markings: Stamped in purple ink, lower left: Museum for the Arts of Decoration / Cooper Union (Lugt 457c)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: At left, handle in shape of bird's head, foliated. Scrolls and a mask form the foot. Satyrs, maenads, and children make up the body. Young Bacchus, leaning on shoulder, raises a shell with his left hand.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Majolica pitcher", 18th century.
18th century. Black chalk, pen and black-brown ink, brush and sepia, blue wash on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-908.
